identity.name: RallyCommand
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Motorsport Telemetry with SaaS Precision
Emotion First: Every screen feels like a pit lane monitor
Content is King: Data density is beautiful
Contrast: Neon alerts against deep obsidian backgrounds

general: Implement the 'Performance Pro' archetype: Dark, Technical, Fast.
Use 'Barlow Condensed' for all headings to give that race-day feel.
Use 'JetBrains Mono' for all part numbers, prices, and quantities.
Ensure all containers have a subtle border (zinc-800) to define structure in the dark theme.
Use the 'Race Red' (#EF4444) sparingly for CTAs and critical alerts. Do not overuse.
Inventory tables should look like telemetry data streams: dense, monospaced, high contrast.
layout_rules: Dashboard: Use the Bento Grid Mode B (High Density).
Inventory List: Use a 'Grid Borders' style. Visible borders between rows and columns.
Forms: Use sharp corners (rounded-sm) and dark inputs with light borders on focus.
animations: Add subtle entrance animations for table rows (staggered).
Use 'hover:border-primary' on interactive cards to simulate a 'target lock' effect.

universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
